## Description {#details}

Insert wait instructions for memory reads and writes.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory">Memory</a> reads and writes are issued asynchronously, so we need to insert S&#95;WAITCNT instructions when we want to access any of their results or overwrite any register that&#39;s used asynchronously.

TODO: This pass currently keeps one timeline per hardware counter. A more finely-grained approach that keeps one timeline per event type could sometimes get away with generating weaker s&#95;waitcnt instructions. For example, when both SMEM and LDS are in flight and we need to wait for the i-th-last LDS instruction, then an lgkmcnt(i) is actually sufficient, but the pass will currently generate a conservative lgkmcnt(0) because multiple event types are in flight.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The mapping is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  0                .. SQ&#95;MAX&#95;PGM&#95;VGPRS-1               real VGPRs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  SQ&#95;MAX&#95;PGM&#95;VGPRS .. NUM&#95;ALL&#95;VGPRS-1                  extra VGPR-like slots</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  NUM&#95;ALL&#95;VGPRS    .. NUM&#95;ALL&#95;VGPRS+SQ&#95;MAX&#95;PGM&#95;SGPRS-1 real SGPRs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We reserve a fixed number of VGPR slots in the scoring tables for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// special tokens like SCMEM&#95;LDS (needed for buffer load to LDS).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8f"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8f">RegisterMapping</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8faebce3f552a3d4135d06f8f6dcf356ff4"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8faebce3f552a3d4135d06f8f6dcf356ff4">SQ&#95;MAX&#95;PGM&#95;VGPRS</a> = 512, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Maximum programmable VGPRs across all targets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa7abf62de8745888264bd875ee49238f0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa7abf62de8745888264bd875ee49238f0">AGPR&#95;OFFSET</a> = 256,      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Maximum programmable ArchVGPRs across all targets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fabca3e41fab3e1bfd004160c4c334587a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fabca3e41fab3e1bfd004160c4c334587a">SQ&#95;MAX&#95;PGM&#95;SGPRS</a> = 256, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Maximum programmable SGPRs across all targets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa4fa3be5a7c2744fdeb5ec65683600936"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa4fa3be5a7c2744fdeb5ec65683600936">NUM&#95;EXTRA&#95;VGPRS</a> = 9,    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Reserved slots for DS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Artificial register slots to track LDS writes into specific LDS locations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if a location is known. When slots are exhausted or location is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unknown use the first slot. The first slot is also always updated in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// addition to known location&#39;s slot to properly generate waits if dependent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction&#39;s location is unknown.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa082e837576678f09ce5d8bf2b19d5e58"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa082e837576678f09ce5d8bf2b19d5e58">EXTRA&#95;VGPR&#95;LDS</a> = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa813511b813d8f33c55787021db83c67b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa813511b813d8f33c55787021db83c67b">NUM&#95;ALL&#95;VGPRS</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8faebce3f552a3d4135d06f8f6dcf356ff4">SQ&#95;MAX&#95;PGM&#95;VGPRS</a> + <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#ac72c82b6709bc2504686d809d61b5e8fa4fa3be5a7c2744fdeb5ec65683600936">NUM&#95;EXTRA&#95;VGPRS</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Where SGPR starts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Enumerate different types of result-returning VMEM operations. Although</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// s&#95;waitcnt orders them all with a single vmcnt counter, in the absence of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// s&#95;waitcnt only instructions of the same VmemType are guaranteed to write</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// their results in order -- so there is no need to insert an s&#95;waitcnt between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two instructions of the same type that write the same vgpr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7f"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7f">VmemType</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// BUF instructions and MIMG instructions without a sampler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7fa83d25c51b8c8e1e8cd1a90575f3ab3fa"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7fa83d25c51b8c8e1e8cd1a90575f3ab3fa">VMEM&#95;NOSAMPLER</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// MIMG instructions with a sampler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7fa3a8aed3686126e3afba0d1ebab077181"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7fa3a8aed3686126e3afba0d1ebab077181">VMEM&#95;SAMPLER</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// BVH instructions</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7fad9c26c725e7882a4a53f8490013c2a66"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a7e0c506d37a9a462f9eece012cefae7fad9c26c725e7882a4a53f8490013c2a66">NUM&#95;VMEM&#95;TYPES</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Maps values of InstCounterType to the instruction that waits on that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// counter. Only used if GCNSubtarget::hasExtendedWaitCounts()</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;event type has no associated counter&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This objects maintains the current score brackets of each wait counter, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a per-register scoreboard for each wait counter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We also maintain the latest score for every event type that can change the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// waitcnt in order to know if there are multiple types of events within</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the brackets. When multiple types of event happen in the bracket,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// wait count may get decreased out of order, therefore we need to put in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;s&#95;waitcnt 0&quot; before use.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a346ebb0249f57a1f637b365cf0d250c0">WaitcntBrackets</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This editing will usually be merely updated operands, but it may also</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The number of outstanding events for this type, T, can be calculated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as (UB - LB). If the current Count is greater than or equal to the number</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of outstanding events, then the wait for this counter is redundant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a845e08be4b0320d66901a66b0c0e9509">Count</a> &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a0be60a3df71875c3240619489d10ec4f">getScoreRange</a>(T))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1590"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Currently all conventions wait, but this may not always be the case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1591"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1592"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: If IPRA is enabled, and the callee is isSafeForNoCSROpt, it may make</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1593"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// senses to omit the wait and do it in the caller.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1594"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1595"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1596"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1597"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\returns true if the callee is expected to wait for any outstanding waits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// before returning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599" lineLink="#a12875f783295ef0f67d11ae574bdcfdd"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a12875f783295ef0f67d11ae574bdcfdd">callWaitsOnFunctionReturn</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>) &#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  Generate s&#95;waitcnt instruction to be placed before cur&#95;Inst.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1602"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  Instructions of a given type are returned in order,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  but instructions of different types can complete out of order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  We rely on this in-order completion</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  and simply assign a score to the memory access instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  We keep track of the active &quot;score bracket&quot; to determine</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1607"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  if an access of a memory read requires an s&#95;waitcnt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  and if so what the value of each counter is.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  The &quot;score bracket&quot; is bound by the lower bound and upper bound</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  scores (&#42;&#95;score&#95;LB and &#42;&#95;score&#95;ub respectively).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  If FlushVmCnt is true, that means that we want to generate a s&#95;waitcnt to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1612"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  flush the vmcnt counter here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1613" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/siinsertwaitcnts/#a8a42c531875f7db92f2c697b823654b5"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/siinsertwaitcnts/#a8a42c531875f7db92f2c697b823654b5">SIInsertWaitcnts::generateWaitcntInstBefore</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets">WaitcntBrackets</a> &amp;ScoreBrackets,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1615"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;OldWaitcntInstr,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1616"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                 </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FlushVmCnt) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1617"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/siinsertwaitcnts/#a90a2b453bf3ce25f979403d9d95c7070">setForceEmitWaitcnt</a>();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1684"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The function is going to insert a wait on everything in its prolog.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vccz bit, so when we detect that an instruction may read from a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2221"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 Restore the correct value of vccz by writing the current value</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2331"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Return true if it is better to flush the vmcnt counter in the preheader of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the given loop. We currently decide to flush in two situations:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 The loop contains vmem store(s), no vmem load and at least one use of a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    vgpr containing a value that is loaded outside of the loop. (Only on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    targets with no vscnt counter).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 The loop contains vmem load(s), but the loaded values are not used in the</span></CodeLine>
